data.question: What is the name of the metal-organic framework discussed in the text?
What is the empirical formula of FJI-H14?
What is the crystal system of FJI-H14?
What is the temperature at which the crystal data of FJI-H14 was measured?
What is the CO2 uptake of FJI-H14 at 298 K and 1 atm in cm3 cm-3?
Can FJI-H14 be reused without losing its adsorption capacity?
data.answer: Yes, FJI-H14 can be recycled without losing its adsorption capacity.

data.question: Is FJI-H14 stable in boiling water?
data.answer: Yes, FJI-H14 is very stable in boiling water.

data.question: What is the method used for the synthesis of FJI-H14?
data.answer: The synthesis method involves mixing H2BTTA ligand and Cu(NO3)2 in water and then heating at 120 °C for 3 days.

data.question: What is the role of FJI-H14 in CO2 capture?
data.answer: FJI-H14 acts as an adsorbing agent for post-combustion CO2 capture due to its high volumetric uptake of CO2 under ambient conditions.

data.question: Does FJI-H14 have a high density of active sites for CO2 capture?
data.answer: Yes, FJI-H14 has a high density of active sites, which contributes to its high CO2 adsorption capacity.

data.question: What is the chemical stability of FJI-H14 in acid/base environment?
data.answer: FJI-H14 is stable in both acid and base environments at pH = 2 to pH = 12 and at temperatures as high as 373 K.

data.question: What is the maximum pore diameter of FJI-H14?
Can FJI-H14 catalyze the conversion of CO2 into cyclic carbonates?
data.answer: Yes, FJI-H14 can catalyze the chemical transformation of CO2 into corresponding cyclic carbonates.

data.question: What is the method used for large-scale synthesis of FJI-H14?
data.answer: The large-scale synthesis involves mixing H2BTTA ligand and Cu(NO3)2 in water and then refluxing for 1 day.

data.question: What is the yield of cyclic carbonates when using FJI-H14 as a catalyst with simulated post-combustion CO2?
Is FJI-H14 more active than HKUST-1 for the cycloaddition of CO2 with epoxides?
data.answer: Yes, FJI-H14 displays a higher catalytic activity for cycloaddition of CO2 with epoxides than HKUST-1.

data.question: What is the CO2/N2 selectivity of FJI-H14 at 298 K?
What is the role of open metal sites (OMS) and Lewis basic sites (LBS) in FJI-H14?
data.answer: OMS and LBS in FJI-H14 synergistically capture CO2 molecules in the pores, improving the adsorption capacity.

data.question: Is FJI-H14 thermally stable up to 230 °C?
data.answer: Yes, FJI-H14 is thermally stable up to 230 °C.

data.question: What is the formula weight of FJI-H14?
